title: Shaina learns from older sister’s mistakes
text:
Shaina learns from older sister’s mistakes By Maridol Ranoa-Bismark (philstar.com) | Updated February 14, 2017 - 11:45am 'The Better Half' lead stars JC De Vera, Shaina Magdayao, Denise Laurel, and Carlo Aquino ABS-CBN/Released 
MANILA, Philippines — Shaina Magdayao knows how it is to have loved and lost. To her credit, the Kapamilya actress has refused to become bitter over a lost love. 
She is loveless by choice. But that does not mean she is through with relationships. 
“If you love the person, and you think he’s worth taking the risk for, go ahead,” she gives her advice to those dilly-dallying over love. 
Even then, she is the type who knows when to hope and when to stop pining for someone, or something. For her, it is either someone comes into your life at the right time, at the right place, or not at all. 
“You don’t even have to lift a finger. If the person is right for you, love shouldn’t be hard to find,” she told writers at the presscon of ABS-CBN’s new suspense-drama, “The Better Half,” where she stars with JC de Vera, Carlo Aquino, Denise Laurel, Epi Quizon, and Carmi Martin, among others. 
Shaina plays Camille, whose life turns upside down after her husband Marco (Carlo) had an accident and she meets Rafael (JC). Just when things seem to be going Camile’s way, Marco returns – this time, as somebody else’s (Denise’s) husband. 
Shaina admits Camille’s struggles to move on are similar to hers in real life. 
“I can relate to my character, so I totally embraced the role.” 
Shaina herself is struggling with questions about entering into a new relationship. She is not ready for one, even if she has been loveless for quite some time. 
Vina Morales’s sister and the youngest of four children has seen her older siblings’ relationship struggles and learned from them. 
Shaina thanks her lucky stars that she was born as the youngest in the family. 
“It gives a big advantage,” she mused. “I’ve seen what my sisters went through and I learn from their mistakes.” 
This makes her extra careful about choosing the guy she’ll fall in love with the next time around. Shaina knows how important it is to make herself complete before sharing her life again with another. 
“I have to go through a process. I have to take my time so I’ll be sure of myself. I have to be whole, so I can share more (with the man I love),” she explained. 
And when the time comes, Shaina promises to share her joy with friends from the press. 
Although she has proven that she can combine love and career, Shaina would rather focus on work for now. 
“The year started right for me. ‘Better Half’ is airing earlier than expected (it kicked off last February 13). And I’m overwhelmed. I think I still have a purpose in being part of this industry.” 
Unlike Vina, who started as a singer, Shaina’s first love is acting. The former child actress began acting at seven, when she was cast in the lead role of the drama series “Lyra.” 
As she gets caught up in “The Better Half’s” twists and turns, and in her character’s intense emotions, Shaina will not allow anything – even love – to get in the way. 
That is how devoted she is to work. And that is how Shaina has managed to stay in the industry for more than two decades – with actors who are just as serious with their craft, stoking that inner fire that continues to consume them.
